action.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: bond, tie, moon, string, czech, row, casino, concert, link.
Your opponent's team words are: bark, beat, platypus, pyramid, hotel, alien, robin, centaur.
Distractor words are: pass, belt, leprechaun, star, eye, tag, mug.
The kill words are: ninja.
action.label: context

action.content:
<reasoning>
Let's tackle this clue-giving problem. The user's team has words like bond, tie, moon, string, czech, row, casino, concert, link. I need to find a single-word clue that relates to as many of these as possible without being one of the words themselves or containing parts of them.

First, let's look for common themes. Bond and tie are both about connecting things. String and link also relate to connecting or tying. Moon might be a stretch, but maybe something related to celestial bodies? Czech could be tricky—maybe a country, but not sure. Row is about conflict or a line of things. Casino and concert are both places or events. Hmm.

Wait, bond, tie, string, link all have to do with connecting or being tied together. Moon... maybe not. Czech is a country, maybe not. Row could be a line or conflict. Casino and concert are different. Maybe focus on the connecting ones. Bond (as in relationships), tie (as in knot or clothing), string (as in thread), link (as in connected links). So maybe "knot"? But "tie" is a knot, but "knot" might not cover all. Alternatively, "tie" itself is a word, but the clue can't be one of the target words. So "knot" could work for tie, string, maybe link? Not sure. Alternatively, "bond" is a connection, but
action.label: response

content.message: Your answer contained more than two lines, please only give one clue and your targets on two separate lines.
